story:
We've already started shipping successfully!

It takes 7-20 business days from Korea to the US.

What is SUJI-IN?

SUJI-IN is a smart bookmark that follows your reading.

 

The thumb part always keep your spot automatically.

SUJI-IN has been invented and developed by Namhyun Kim and this is made in Korea.

This is also a patented product in Korea : 10-1126794 KR, 10-1633511 KR, 10-1626792 KR

Korean ver(한국자막영상) 

 

 

 

What makes SUJI-IN different from normal bookmarks?

Once you’ve placed it in your book, you don’t have to worry about remembering the page number. It helps you to focus on your book better. As you know, if you use a normal bookmark, you have to prepare it and put it in a book every time you stop reading.

 

But this smart bookmark, SUJI-IN, solves this problem very simply! When you need to get off a bus, when your phone rings, when suddenly you feel sleepy while you're reading a book, all you have to do is just close the book with SUJI-IN! You’ll find the thumb part at the page you stopped last.

Also, SUJI-IN is totally reusable! Once you’ve finished reading a book, simply use it again in another book.

 


How does it work?

SUJI-IN has two magnets and a thumb part.

No matter how thick your book is, SUJI-IN always can be used.

 

How long can I use it?

This product is made out of plastic. People usually use it for over a year. The longest period of using SUJI-IN is about three years. This is the record of the inventor himself! 

Durability depends on how you use it. Unless you bend the bending part too often by hand, it can be used semi-permanently.

Also, magnets are strong enough! You don't have to worry about losing your bookmarks anymore.

 

 

How many bookmarks do I need?

Usually, one person needs 5 to 10 products. In general, few people read one book at a time. We recommend you to have 20-30 because if you show this product to your family and friends, maybe you will only have a few left.

 

 

Themes

 

1. San Francisco

2. Masterpieces (Hokusai, Gogh, Alphons Mucha)

3. Korean Patterns

* These designs can be modified little bit.

**Cameos can be added to San Francisco theme bookmarks. And this will update when the design is finished.

 

 

Name SUJI-IN

Especially for backers who buy more than $ 55, we will create and send you a couple of personalized bookmarks with your name. The design looks like this and your first name will be in. If you have any other name or word you want, please leave a message via comment.

 

 

Reward

 

($ 14) 1 Pack (8pcs)

($ 24) 2 Packs (16pcs)

($ 31) 3 Packs (24pcs)

($ 58) 6 Packs (48pcs)

Get 48 bookmarks, 6 special postcards and a couple of special bookmarks with your name!

($120) 15 Packs (120pcs)

Get 120 bookmarks, 15 special postcards and a couple of special bookmarks with your name!

 

 

Size

 

The Meaning of SUJI-IN

 

SUJI-IN means the trace left on paper by hand.

 

 

 

Our Story

 

 

At first, SUJI-IN was a part of my first book called IQ FESTIVAL that I had written about 10 years ago.The book is about brain development. Unlike other brain books, I wanted to let people know what they could do if they developed their brain.That's why I spent two months trying to invent an automatic bookmark as an inventor. If you want to know more about my story, I hope you take a look at this video(Coming Soon)

I came from South Korea to Silicon Valley to commercialize a service called BCode which is a two-dimensional code.In the meantime, I met a designer Song who lives in San Francisco through our mutual friends.Song was deeply in love with San Francisco and she could express it with her work. I gave a SUJI-IN to Song, and she said she wanted to put her work on SUJI-IN. So we became a team.

Jenny, who lived in San Diego, worked for an IT company and came to San Jose. Jenny is my relative and has a wide variety of talents. She is fluent in languages and design, and she handles IT devices fairly well and enjoys games. When Jenny came to San Jose, she suggested that crowdfunding would be the best way to promote this product to people. I had been worried for a while, but soon I understood that the suggestion was quite appropriate and sounded interesting! Jenny immediately became a marketer for our team.

I'd like to give you pleasure and convenience of reading books with SUJI-IN, Song wants to show the beauty of San Francisco by her work. Jenny is already showing off her talent as much as she wants :)

 

 

Process

 

Custom Bookmarks


Custom bookmarks work great for all kinds of businesses as well as public institutions and libraries. The images shown below have actually been produced and delivered. If you have any questions about customization, please feel free to contact us.

Minimum quantity of 300 ($ 270)

automaticbookmark@gmail.com / sonsory@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello there! I am Eric Vernor, or as many of you know me, the author Corvis Nocturnum.  I would like to introduce you to a new venture in my life for which I have a passion. My passion is to enrich peoples senses, not only with the books, music and film projects I have partnered up with some very talented people on, but also with a new line of candles and incense - for those with discriminating tastes!

    Light your bedchamber with heavily scented candles especially made for the children of the night, in solid red or black wax. You will be taken back to days gone by as the rich aroma fills the air with coordinating scents from incense blends such as Dragon’s Blood, Leather and Chains, Devil’s Den and Black Rose.

  • Your help is invaluable in helping us obtain the various supplies, packaging materials and labels. We pride ourselves on making a top quality product, from the rich scent to the packaging of the merchandise you will be receiving. We are confident that, with your assistance, we will be able to provide the very best aromatic accoutrement for your home and ritual chamber.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We could use your help to start up this business venture because we feel there are few quality companies selling these types of products who have the darker inclined people in mind. We would like to change that and become the one you seek out.
  • To show our appreciation for your generosity, those who help us will be receiving gifts of the very products you helped make happen, when the campaign is over.

The Impact

  • All of the funds donated will be used for the goal. Every campaign on Indigogo that we have been involved with has been accomplished, be it before or after the sixty days. We are dedicated to expanding the brand of DMP to the Goths, musicians and alternative clientele all over the world with quality creations.
  • DMP has successfully launched and funded the Eerie America Travel Guide of the Macabre project (the unseen portion came from the executive producer) and 100% of the Ligea Resurrected CD, Black Diamond!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you may not be able to spare five dollars to contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please assist us in getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Remember, you can use the Indiegogo share tools on Facebook, Twitter or on your own blog-site!

Thank you all for your help. We sincerely appreciate it!

story:
OVERVIEW
 MyPersonal911 (MP911) was created to assist in solving the crisis of mission people in the United States. According to the US Department of Justice, nearly 800,000 children younger than 18 are missing each year.  That is over 2,185 children reported missing each day.  

Be a part of the solution.   My Personal 911 allows the public the ability to send an alert out to individuals to inform them of a missing person.
Most people will have their smartphones handy... ready to respond.  Our mobile app allows other MP911 users to immediately help you and local authorities... quickly and effectively.



WHY WE NEED YOU
By supporting us here on IndieGoGo, you can save the life of a child, teens, and even adults.  While we wish ill on no one, MyPersonal911 is more than an ounce of prevention.  It’s worth a ton of cure.  For your contribution, each contributor will receive a FREE copy of the app.  Moreover, our App Advocates & All-Stars will have direct input during the development, deployment, and marketing phases.  You can play a critical role in saving someone’s life!

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?  How we plan to use the $300,500?  We are a lean team with an ambitious vision to save lives and keep families informed during times of crisis.   MyPersonal911 is preparing to launch this unique app in the state Georgia, which has a population of 9,687,653:   We plan to use the funds to market our Mobile App at key “demographic” trade shows, conventions, and even school-related events to reach over 5,0000 potential users in the next 6 months. 

 MyPersonal911 is seeking to connect with the Center for Missing & Exploited Children and state agencies. 



THE IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION
The impact of your contribution is immediate.  MyPersonal911 addresses the vital need of alerting others near you in times of emergency.  As an example, in a child abduction, MyPersonal911 would alert all users within 5 miles of your location with a Photo and key data like height, weight, hair & eye color, and more.  



MORE CREATIVE WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Thanks a billion!  We thank you for previewing our funding campaign for MyPersonal911.  Please, share our message of saving lives using the social media tools on IndieGoGo.

story:
Wireless HDMI


Airtame is a small wireless HDMI device that plugs into the HDMI port of any screen or projector. Unlike other wireless HDMI devices, nothing is plugged into your computer or smartphone. Simply download our app and stream your content to the screen from any major computer platform, tablet, or smartphone. When no one is streaming to the TV, you can set the default display to show a website or dashboard for something functional, like sales numbers, or just to show something pretty, like your company logo. Learn more at airtame.com

But that’s just what it does now. We have a very ambitious plan for a wireless future.





Share what’s on your computer, tablet 
or mobile screen wirelessly



Set a dashboard or website as background 
when no one is streaming



With  must-have features for a setup 
in a professional setting.





Do I need to plug anything into my computer, tablet or phone?

No most certainly not. The whole idea behind Airtame is that we don’t care which device you have or what plugs are in it. You only need to install our small app on your device and then you can stream to Airtame over WiFi.


Does the Airtame need power?

Yes! We haven’t invented wireless power..yet. So it’s powered with (an included) USB cable + power socket. Most TV’s actually have a USB power you can use - right next to the HDMI port.

Check more here


How easy is it to set up Airtame

A normal unboxing and set up can be done in 5-10 minutes if it’s first time you try. We recommend taking a look at the getting started guides we have made that will give you better understanding and learn to set up Airtame devices in 2 minutes.

Check more here


Do you mirror the entire screen from phones and tablets?

No, not yet. Right now we have apps for Android and iOS devices where we can show content like images, PDFs, Keynote, PPT and other work files. For presentations that’s really cool, because you can then have an overview of your next slides etc., while only showing “the current” on Airtame.

You can read more about it in these quick guides


Do you support Windows Phone?

Not yet, but we are looking into the Windows 10 platform and will update when we know more about it.


When will you ship if I order a perk now?

We are shipping daily. Buy today at airtame.com or Amazon


Do you ship to all countries?

Not yet unfortunately. But if you go to our website you can see the full list and sign up to get notified when we start shipping to your country.
story_txt:
Wireless HDMI





Airtame is a small wireless HDMI device that plugs into the HDMI port of any screen or projector. Unlike other wireless HDMI devices, nothing is plugged into your computer or smartphone. Simply download our app and stream your content to the screen from any major computer platform, tablet, or smartphone. When no one is streaming to the TV, you can set the default display to show a website or dashboard for something functional, like sales numbers, or just to show something pretty, like your company logo. Learn more at airtame.com
But that’s just what it does now. We have a very ambitious plan for a wireless future.









Share what’s on your computer, tablet or mobile screen wirelessly




Set a dashboard or website as background when no one is streaming



With  must-have features for a setup in a professional setting.

story:
From You, To You

The GK68XS was designed by you, for you. Throughout our project development, we have constantly been in touch with mechanical keyboard communities and enthusiasts worldwide in an effort to design the best keyboard possible. We are now proud to present the culmination of over a year’s worth of our team’s R&D work. With 68-keys, the GK68XS is the perfect combination of compact design and quality construction with fully customizable functions. With dual connectivity modes (wireless or wired) and both Windows and Mac layouts, the GK68XS is the ultimate match for any device setup. It easily pairs with up to three devices at once to maximize productivity and ease of use. With its compact form and durable aluminum casing, the GK68XS is ready for any setting! 

 

 

The cult behind mechanical keyboards is deep - and for good reason too. Mechanical switches deliver an unmistakable satisfaction that traditional membrane keyboards can never provide

Each key stroke provides a sure tactile sensation and click, with much further key travel and quicker response than traditional membrane keyboards. This ensures that each word you type is accurate, without ever having to worry about having put down the wrong letter. Additionally, the ergonomics of mechanical keyboards and their switches provide much more comfort that is safer on the wrists and fingers. Your work and gaming experience will absolutely change with a mechanical keyboard. You may even find yourself enjoying long typing sessions on your next assignment! Once you try a quality mechanical keyboard, you can never go back!

 

 

 

Advanced Space Bar Module

The GK68 Space Key Module will provide you with endless customization. Whether it's a single key or a split spacebar style to best fit your typing preference and feel, the GK68XS is here to take your gaming and daily work to the next level.

 

 

Fully Programmable Layout

You can reprogram any key on the GK68XS to make custom macros and add layers for extra function. To further personalize your typing experience, the advanced three-switch space bar can be converted into one space bar + FN2 and FN3 keys, to expand up to three FN function keys. Your macros and layout mapping will forever revolutionize how you interact with your program softwares and games. 

 

 

Wired or Wireless - The choice is yours!

Designed for versatility, the GK68XS is available in two models: the GK68X and the GK68XS. The GK68XS can connect via Bluetooth for wireless connectivity or with the included Type-C USB cable. With Bluetooth 5.1, it easily connects seamlessly with your phone, laptop, or tablet. Connect wirelessly with up to three devices at once, and easily switch between devices for efficient multitasking and speedy performance. And with just a simple switch on the slide toggle, you can quickly switch between operating system layouts on the GK68XS. The GK68 is a wired keyboard for a more traditional setup, and features every aspect of the GK68XS, minus the wireless connectivity. The GK68 is a perfect match for those who do not require a wireless setup. 

The GK68XS - it's not just a keyboard, it's the paramount productivity tool for your daily work! 

 

 

 

With hot-swappable Gateron or Cherry MX switches, make every press feel exactly the way you want it!

The GK68XS is now hot-swappable! A rare feature among mechanical keyboards, this means you can easily change out your mechanical switches for a different type, without any soldering or effort. Want a different typing feel or sound? Simply change out the switches, and you can have a completely different tactile experience! This also extends the lifespan of the keyboard as you can easily switch out the components without throwing out the entire keyboard.  

To appease every customer, we have provided two of the most popular and renowned brands for mechanical keyboards - Cherry MX and Gateron! Each is popular for the unique feel and long-lasting lifespan of the switches. You can rest assured that your GK68XS is manufactured with the best and most reliable mechanical switches out there! 

 

 

Mac, Windows, or Android - We got it all covered! 

 

The GK68XS is fully compatible with every operating system (OS) from Mac/iOS to Android and Windows, and you can easily switch between the different OS with just the flip of a switch. The GK68XS is one of the few mechanical keyboards featuring the Mac layout media keys for the comprehensive integration of the UI. It allows you to use all of the same media keys as a conventional macOS keyboard, but with the unparalleled typing satisfaction of mechanical switches. Every GK68XS keyboard comes with 3 specific keycaps for Mac and Windows, respectively. Compatible with every version of each operating system.  

 

 

Durable Construction, Lightweight Portability 

 

The GK68XS was designed to be a mobile and compact device for any setting. The lightweight body is constructed from precision CNC aluminum or ABS plastic to maximize durability and tactile satisfaction. Both materials build to provide a stable and firm foundation, no matter how hard you type. The ABS plastic provides a slightly lighter and more portable experience with the benefit of a more affordable price point. The full aluminum option is a more premium feature that is hard sought after by mechanical keyboard communities. Championed over plastic frames, mechanical keyboard enthusiasts have always loved the aluminum body for its durability, as well as the distinct tactile feel and sound that no plastic body can reproduce. The frames were designed with a low profile for a streamlined look that complements any setup, and easy on the wrist even without any wrist pads. 

The small footprint makes it easy to carry around with you everywhere, and unlike many foldable Bluetooth keyboards, the GK68XS offers the best of portability without compromising the premium typing experience of a mechanical keyboard. Plus, with a fully customizable keycap setup, you can easily change out the keys to fit your aesthetics and typing feel.

 

 

The GK68XS features RGB lighting with 16.8 million LED colors, rhythm, and sound lighting combinations, with additional key-programming and macro-creation for three definable layers. With 16.8 million colors in RGB lights, you can download additional lighting effects to the library and easily use them through the lighting effects driver. Simply connect the keyboard using the USB cable to access effects and software updates. Our database is constantly updating with different lighting effects. Enjoy a more immersive and colorful typing and gaming experience.

 

We chose to go with a top-grade PBT thermal sublimation keycaps. PBT keycaps are often considered the top choice for keycap materials, even over ABS keycaps, as PBT is much more durable, oil-resistant (won’t get shiny over time like ABS), and stays true to color longer. Our keycaps are also abrasion-resistant, waterproof, and dust resistant to keep your keyboard lasting longer - even for the daily on-the-go lifestyle. The keycap form was developed for a more ergonomic and comfortable typing experience, with a smooth curvature that perfectly fits the shape of each finger. Several choices of designs and colors are available, each custom designed by our team to meet everyone’s style. Additionally, the spacebar can be customized using the included key options, whether it be one long single bar, or a three-way split space bar to increase speed, ease of pressing, and feel.

 

To maximize the full functionality of the GK68XS’s features, we have integrated a 32-bit M3 MCU chipset with onboard 8M Flash Memory, and 3 channel 256 professional-level RGB color management chip. Your keyboard programming and macro customizations will be seamless, and you can be sure of smooth user experience. 

 

Each keyboard comes with your choice of mechanical switches, so you can get just the feel you like—whether you prefer something heavy and tactile, or lightweight and linear. We offer two major and most popular brands in mechanical switches - Cherry and Gateron. Plus, the GK68XS is hot-swappable, meaning you can simply switch out the mechanical switches without any soldering!

 

Already have a favorite Cherry MX mechanical switch? We have you covered. The GK68XS is available with classic Cherry MX Blue, Brown, Red, or Black switches.

  • The MX Blue switch provides the most tactile sensation and sound, with the distinct “click” noise characteristic of mechanical keyboards.
  • The MX Brown switch offers a similar tactile sensation as the Blue, but is a little bit quieter for office use.
  • The MX Red switch is linear in feel, and do not have a tactile bump like the Blue or Brown switches. This means you can feel the switch go all the way down and up, in a very smooth fashion. The Red switch is also much quieter than the Blue or Brown switches, which makes it ideal for work settings.
  • The MX Black switch is a linear switch, similar to the MX Red switch, but with a heavier operating force. The Black switch is perfect for those wanting a quiet typing session, but with a heavier feel than the traditional MX red switch. 

Gateron switches are popular around the world for their durability and distinct tactile and sonic characteristics. We offer the Gateron Optical switches, which have a much smoother press than traditional Gateron switches, and have a longer lifespan of 100 million keystrokes. 

  •  The Gateron Blue switch gives a tactile sensation and sound, with a noticeable bump with each press to ensure every keystroke is on point. 
  • The Gateron Red switch is a linear switch that presses smoothly down without any bump or click in between presses. This also means a much quieter typing sound that is perfect for the office workspace. 
  • The Gateron Brown switch is a tactile switch like the Gateron Blue switch, but with a much quieter sound for sound-sensitive environments. Many see the Brown switch as an in-between of the Blue and Red switches. 
  • The Gateron Black switch is a linear switch like that of the Gateron Red switch, but has a heavier feel. This means you will feel a little more resistance as you press down than the Gateron Red switch, and is a perfect match for heavy typers who want confidence with every stroke. 

The biggest customization for your GK68XS will be the type of mechanical switch you choose. This will determine how your keyboard will feel and sound when you type. Do you want something that has a distinct “click-clack” feel or something is smooth and gliding? Do you want your key types to be loud and “clicky” or silent for the office? With our selection of Gateron and Cherry MX switches, you can choose the perfect typing sensation for you! 

From backlighting and key commands to switches and keycaps, our mechanical keyboards offer customizable options for today's tasks and trends. Fine-tune yours as much (or as little) as you want!

 

DIY With Your Own Switches!

Want to make your own personal custom keyboard? The GK68XS is available as just the case! Choose from the wired or wireless setup and ABS plastic or CNC aluminum build, and you can build from the ground up. Because the GK68XS is hot-swappable, you can purchase your own mechanical switches to pair with our case. We’ll even throw in a set of keycaps! 

 

 

 
 
 
 

Stay Home, Stay Safe

We had initially planned to launch the Epomaker GK68 campaign much later into the year. However, as the world struggles with the onset of the Covid19 pandemic, we have received feedback and suggestions from the community. We have decided to push the campaign earlier to share a small amount of hope and provide a better typing and working experience for your home workspace.

Our desire is to make your daily work and gaming experience more enjoyable through the satisfaction of using a mechanical keyboard. Our goal is to get the GK68XS into the hands of everyone who wishes to experience a whole new workflow through this incredible workplace essential. We wish this crowdfunding campaign can bring the GK68XS at an affordable price range for everyone to enjoy. We know that waiting is annoying, especially during these hard days. We are currently pushing ahead of the schedule in manufacturing so that we can get the Epomaker GK68XS keyboard into your hands sooner. We hope our product can bring you some extra joy and peace during these anxious times. We encourage everyone to stay safe and experience new pleasure in your work at home through our keyboard. 

 

Composed of a team of young gamers, software engineers, and product designers who love tech gadgets, we set out to develop the best products that encapsulate personality, functionality, and affordability. Unsatisfied with the keyboards currently out there, we have created our own ultimate portable, wireless and fully-customizable mechanical keyboard to meet all of your daily needs. Our promise is to deliver a keyboard that meets all of your workflow needs, with a fashionable style, and a budget-friendly price.

 

About Skyloong 

 

With the motto of “Personalized Customization”, Skyloong has always focused on research and development for the production of better mechanical keyboards that meet the personalized typing experiences of customers. Being the manufacturer for many of the world’s most famous and reputable mechanical keyboard brands, Skyloong has been praised around the world for its excellence in hardware and software development. Epomaker has teamed up with Skyloong to put together the best portable bluetooth mechanical keyboard, and we could not be more thrilled to have Skyloong’s time-tested skills and expertise for this project. Skyloong will continue to aim to become the greatest international manufacturer of mechanical keyboards and to deliver the best personalized typing experience.

story:
Campaign Over!


But don't fret, you can still pre-order boards! 
https://www.trycelery.com/shop/mavboard

Introducing the MAVBoard!

The MAVBoard is a way to share a single MAVLink telemetry connection (the telemetry port on a 3D Robotics APM 2.X, for example) among multiple devices, such as OSDs, telemetry radios, telemetry converters or other add-on boards. Until now, the solution has been to create custom soldered cable harnesses which are difficult to make and not as flexible, since only one device can be connected to the "Tx" pin of the MAVLink connection.


The MAVBoard makes connecting several MAVLink devices a breeze. It is very easy to choose which device can access the "Tx" pin of the MAVLink connection by a simple jumper. Now your OSD, two-way telemetry radio AND FrSky telemetry can all run at the same time without the wiring being a nightmare!


The Pro model also includes on onboard Arduino compatible ATMega328P chip which is also connected to the MAVLink hub that performs protocol translation on the MAVLink stream and output the translated signal to a dedicated set of pins. There is existing code (based on JDrone's jD_IOBoard_FrSkyMAVLink code) today that can translate MAVLink into the FrSky hub protocol so you can the FrSky FLD-02 and see useful telemetry values right on your RC transmitter!


If FrSky had their way, we would all end up with a second altimeter, GPS, voltage monitor, etc on our UAVs with one of their "hubs" connected to the FrSky Rx telemetry port. Most flight controllers, and especially MAVLink based autopilots, already have all these sensors! The MAVBoard's goal is to utilize all those existing sensors in our autopilots and provide a telemetry stream to our RC transmitters.


Work is also in progress to support the new SmartPort protocol uses by the FrSky Taranis radio. OpenLRSng support is also possible with some basic hardware mods to your OpenLRSng Tx module. This will allow telemetry data to show up directly on the Taranis LCD screen without having to attach an external LCD.


This is an Open Source Hardware project! All the schematics and board design files will all be released open source.


Current Status

I started this project about 9 months ago (original announcement: http://diydrones.com/profiles/blogs/sneak-peak-at-mavboard-progress ) with the early prototyping and beta testing to prove the idea. The initial boards used through-hole parts, except for the AVR chip.

I was able to prove the board worked, and get the jD_IOBoard MAVLink to FrSky translation code to work, but knew I needed to go smaller, which meant SMD soldering.


I hand soldered a batch of all SMD-component boards and gave them out to friends to beta test. I have also been flying these boards on all my multi-rotors for the last few months. Results were good, and also made some changes to incorporate feedback, such as having two separate models, one that was just the hub with jumpers and a different model with the AVR chip which included a few more pins broken out.


The result is two boards that are ready for a production run: the MAVBoard Lite and MAVBoard Pro.


MAVBoard Lite

The MAVBoard Lite is a basic board that allows a single MAVLink "IN" connection to be split into 3 "OUT" ports, where a jumper can be used to select which of the 3 OUT connections has its Tx pin connected to the inbound MAVLink connection (such as for a two-way telemetry radio).


MAVBoard Pro

The MAVBoard pro is the 4th round of iterations on the original concept of integrating an AVR chip and a jumpered hub all into one board, with the primary motivation being telemetry conversion applications. The original target was to support FrSky hub protocol translation, as originally written by jDrones for their jD-IOBoard. Later, some members from the DIYDrones community forked their project to fix bugs and cleanup the codebase.


Recently, work has been done to convert the MAVLink protocol to the new FrSky SmartPort protocol, which is used by the new and popular Taranis radio. My plan is to port that code to the AVR platform so it will function on the MAVBoard Pro. Once I get my hands on the very heavily in demand Taranis radio, the port should go quickly.


The indiegogo Campaign

The boards have all been designed, prototyped, tested, redesigned and tested again. Now in order to lower the cost for everyone, I need to do a high volume board run, order components in quantities larger than single units, and work with an assembly house to pick-and-place/reflow all the components. 


The money I raise from this campaign will be used to create a large batch, lowering the cost for all.


At the end of this campaign, I expect to need 30 - 45 days to have the boards made, stuffed, tested and shipped. All boards will come with the SMD components soldered on. You will need to solder the pin headers yourself.


During the campaign and while the boards are being made, I will be working on the following:

  • Detailed installation instructions, such as documenting the various protocol translation firmware, how to flash firmware and wiring diagrams.
  • Porting the MAVLink to SmartPort Taranis code to the MAVBoard Pro.
  • Creating am open source repository for schematics, board design files and firmware.


Bonus For MAVBoard Pro Backers!

All backers of the MAVBoard Pro board type will also receive a FREE PWM to Analog RSSI conversion kit. This tiny board can convert PWM-based RSSI signals (such as those produced by the RSSI ports on FrSky Rx modules) into an analog signal. This is very useful if your flight controller only understands analog RSSI, such as the APM 2.x.

It's a simple but very useful board that connects easily. For APM 2.x, simply connect the PWM side to the RSSI port on your receiver, and the other to an analog port on the APM, and enable RSSI in the mission planner!

You can also place an additional order for this board directly if you want just it, or are only interested in the MAVBoard Lite.


Boards In Action

My hexacopter, with an MinimOSD, 3DR telemetry and FrSky telemetry connected to the MAVBoard Pro:


My quadcopter with a MinimOSD and FrSky telemetry:




When using with the FrSky conversion firmware, here are some example views of what sort of telemetry data you will see on the FLD-02.

GPS and accelerometer data:


APM temperature and GPS sat count:


Battery voltage:



Who Am I?

My name is Mike Machado, and I have been a professional software engineer working with embedded linux, Internet systems, SaaS platforms and enterprise software for the last 15 years. I am also an entrepreneur, avid maker, UAV enthusiast, and have been part of the DIYDrones community for 5+ years. 


I started out with a blimpduino, moved on to the Easy Star and then become fascinated with multirotors, of which I have built at least 6 over the last couple of years. 


I was on a team who did well at the first multi-rotor challenge in San Diego, CA in 2013 and I also competed in the 2013 SparkFun AVC with a quadcopter (which unfortunately had lots of GPS and other interference issues that day).
story_txt:
Campaign Over!But don't fret, you can still pre-order boards! 
https://www.trycelery.com/shop/mavboard
Introducing the MAVBoard!The MAVBoard is a way to share a single MAVLink telemetry connection (the telemetry port on a 3D Robotics APM 2.X, for example) among multiple devices, such as OSDs, telemetry radios, telemetry converters or other add-on boards. Until now, the solution has been to create custom soldered cable harnesses which are difficult to make and not as flexible, since only one device can be connected to the "Tx" pin of the MAVLink connection.The MAVBoard makes connecting several MAVLink devices a breeze. It is very easy to choose which device can access the "Tx" pin of the MAVLink connection by a simple jumper. Now your OSD, two-way telemetry radio AND FrSky telemetry can all run at the same time without the wiring being a nightmare!The Pro model also includes on onboard Arduino compatible ATMega328P chip which is also connected to the MAVLink hub that performs protocol translation on the MAVLink stream and output the translated signal to a dedicated set of pins. There is existing code (based on JDrone's jD_IOBoard_FrSkyMAVLink code) today that can translate MAVLink into the FrSky hub protocol so you can the FrSky FLD-02 and see useful telemetry values right on your RC transmitter!If FrSky had their way, we would all end up with a second altimeter, GPS, voltage monitor, etc on our UAVs with one of their "hubs" connected to the FrSky Rx telemetry port. Most flight controllers, and especially MAVLink based autopilots, already have all these sensors! The MAVBoard's goal is to utilize all those existing sensors in our autopilots and provide a telemetry stream to our RC transmitters.Work is also in progress to support the new SmartPort protocol uses by the FrSky Taranis radio. OpenLRSng support is also possible with some basic hardware mods to your OpenLRSng Tx module. This will allow telemetry data to show up directly on the Taranis LCD screen without having to attach an external LCD.This is an Open Source Hardware project! All the schematics and board design files will all be released open source.Current StatusI started this project about 9 months ago (original announcement: http://diydrones.com/profiles/blogs/sneak-peak-at-mavboard-progress ) with the early prototyping and beta testing to prove the idea. The initial boards used through-hole parts, except for the AVR chip.I was able to prove the board worked, and get the jD_IOBoard MAVLink to FrSky translation code to work, but knew I needed to go smaller, which meant SMD soldering.I hand soldered a batch of all SMD-component boards and gave them out to friends to beta test. I have also been flying these boards on all my multi-rotors for the last few months. Results were good, and also made some changes to incorporate feedback, such as having two separate models, one that was just the hub with jumpers and a different model with the AVR chip which included a few more pins broken out.The result is two boards that are ready for a production run: the MAVBoard Lite and MAVBoard Pro.MAVBoard LiteThe MAVBoard Lite is a basic board that allows a single MAVLink "IN" connection to be split into 3 "OUT" ports, where a jumper can be used to select which of the 3 OUT connections has its Tx pin connected to the inbound MAVLink connection (such as for a two-way telemetry radio).MAVBoard ProThe MAVBoard pro is the 4th round of iterations on the original concept of integrating an AVR chip and a jumpered hub all into one board, with the primary motivation being telemetry conversion applications. The original target was to support FrSky hub protocol translation, as originally written by jDrones for their jD-IOBoard. Later, some members from the DIYDrones community forked their project to fix bugs and cleanup the codebase.Recently, work has been done to convert the MAVLink protocol to the new FrSky SmartPort protocol, which is used by the new and popular Taranis radio. My plan is to port that code to the AVR platform so it will function on the MAVBoard Pro. Once I get my hands on the very heavily in demand Taranis radio, the port should go quickly.The indiegogo CampaignThe boards have all been designed, prototyped, tested, redesigned and tested again. Now in order to lower the cost for everyone, I need to do a high volume board run, order components in quantities larger than single units, and work with an assembly house to pick-and-place/reflow all the components. The money I raise from this campaign will be used to create a large batch, lowering the cost for all.At the end of this campaign, I expect to need 30 - 45 days to have the boards made, stuffed, tested and shipped. All boards will come with the SMD components soldered on. You will need to solder the pin headers yourself.During the campaign and while the boards are being made, I will be working on the following:
Detailed installation instructions, such as documenting the various protocol translation firmware, how to flash firmware and wiring diagrams.
Porting the MAVLink to SmartPort Taranis code to the MAVBoard Pro.
Creating am open source repository for schematics, board design files and firmware.
Bonus For MAVBoard Pro Backers!All backers of the MAVBoard Pro board type will also receive a FREE PWM to Analog RSSI conversion kit. This tiny board can convert PWM-based RSSI signals (such as those produced by the RSSI ports on FrSky Rx modules) into an analog signal. This is very useful if your flight controller only understands analog RSSI, such as the APM 2.x.It's a simple but very useful board that connects easily. I am also an entrepreneur, avid maker, UAV enthusiast, and have been part of the DIYDrones community for 5+ years. I started out with a blimpduino, moved on to the Easy Star and then become fascinated with multirotors, of which I have built at least 6 over the last couple of years. I was on a team who did well at the first multi-rotor challenge in San Diego, CA in 2013 and I also competed in the 2013 SparkFun AVC with a quadcopter (which unfortunately had lots of GPS and other interference issues that day).

story:
Short Summary

  • Building a super computer might sound exotic to you as some sort of work that only the professionals in giant organizations like NASA, Google, Microsoft, and IBM are capable of doing. However, you are about to see it being popularize.
  • The cluster will be used as a password security auditing tool and will be capable of utilizing  various kind of hashing algorithm using Hashcat.
  • The Hashes can be uploaded through this Link to the server.
  • Our Server Link: https://www.gpucluster.ch (Now Defunct)
  • Server View-Only Credential:
    • Username:Beta
    • Password:beta

The Impact

  • Move all of us a step closer to the super-computing domain.
  • Enhance the productivity of password security researchers by running Hashcat on the cluster.
  • Make the world a better place as the server will be dedicated to HIV and cancer research later on at its leisure time through the BOINC Project.
  • Make a dream comes true!
  • Further Reading on GPU Computing

Server Online User Interface

  • All hashes can be safely uploaded to the server because the server is using HTTPS Protocal.
  • The server web user interface is powered by Hashtopussy by s3inlc on GitHub.
  • Hashtopolis is totally open-sourced.

Risks & Challenges

Taking into account that this is a hardware project, the only concern so far is the funding:

  • The expected result of the project depends on the number of GPU we can get; therefore, if not enough funds are raised, the numbers of GPU might drop and might not meet the expected performance. However, the cluster will still be built and the perks will be fulfilled in the best way we can!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even a small amount will help, even though it might be one dollar or so!
  • Share our project with your friends on social medias, YouTube, or even through SMS!

Image Statement

  • Due to the nature of the project, being a hardware, we can only provide you with 3D models of the project which will be slightly different from the final product. However, the models are designed to be as close as it can be to the final product. 
  • Once the funds are raised, the real images of the final product will be uploaded and presented.

Supported Hash Type

  • See Hashcat Wiki for More Information
  • All hashes should be uploaded in the form of Binary Format or HCCAPX Format, as the TXT hashlist format is not supported by the server yet.
  • If you have a hashlist which contains multiple hashes, you can upload them one-by-one instead or contact us through this E-MAIL.

Image Overview

Building a super computer might sound exotic to you as some sort of work that only the professionals in giant organizations like NASA, Google, Microsoft, and IBM are capable of doing. However, you are about to see it being popularize.
The cluster will be used as a password security auditing tool and will be capable of utilizing  various kind of hashing algorithm using Hashcat.
The Hashes can be uploaded through this Link to the server.
Our Server Link: https://www.gpucluster.ch (Now Defunct)
Server View-Only Credential:
Username:Beta
Password:beta




The Impact

Move all of us a step closer to the super-computing domain.
Enhance the productivity of password security researchers by running Hashcat on the cluster.
Make the world a better place as the server will be dedicated to HIV and cancer research later on at its leisure time through the BOINC Project.

Make a dream comes true!
Further Reading on GPU Computing


Server Online User Interface

All hashes can be safely uploaded to the server because the server is using HTTPS Protocal.
The server web user interface is powered by Hashtopussy by s3inlc on GitHub.

Hashtopolis is totally open-sourced.


Risks & Challenges
Taking into account that this is a hardware project, the only concern so far is the funding:
The expected result of the project depends on the number of GPU we can get; therefore, if not enough funds are raised, the numbers of GPU might drop and might not meet the expected performance. However, the cluster will still be built and the perks will be fulfilled in the best way we can!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even a small amount will help, even though it might be one dollar or so!
Share our project with your friends on social medias, YouTube, or even through SMS!

Image Statement
Due to the nature of the project, being a hardware, we can only provide you with 3D models of the project which will be slightly different from the final product. However, the models are designed to be as close as it can be to the final product. 
Once the funds are raised, the real images of the final product will be uploaded and presented.
Supported Hash Type
See Hashcat Wiki for More Information
All hashes should be uploaded in the form of Binary Format or HCCAPX Format, as the TXT hashlist format is not supported by the server yet.
If you have a hashlist which contains multiple hashes, you can upload them one-by-one instead or contact us through this E-MAIL.

story:
We’re excited to announce the 2017 Commit30 daily planner & goal-setting notebook! This isn’t just another planner. It’s a tool to help you take back your time. To put your phone down, to focus on the things that are most important to you and to get after your goals and dreams. Today, not tomorrow. No matter what you are hoping to accomplish in your life, from getting your business off the ground, to running your first marathon, to paying off your debt – you’ll have a great deal more success if you take the time to write it down; create a daily plan & do the work. As Shonda Rhimes so famously said, “Ditch the dream and be a doer.” 

Every vision board needs an action plan.  

This  campaign will directly support the production run of the 2017 Commit30 planner & goal-setting notebooks! 

Help us start the Commit30 Movement! If you share this crowd funding campaign you will get a FREE printable Commit30 PDF (Oct-Dec 2016) to use. Click here to share and download the FREE PDF. Thanks for your support!

240 awesome planning & goal-setting pages. 

  • SIZE: 5.75 x 8.125 x .75" total size (weighs ~ 15 oz). A perfect size for at-your-desk or in a meeting - portable but large enough to write down everything you need to do! Lays flat too!
  • 2017 Yearly Goals & Vision Setting Pages
  • 2017 & 2018 Calendar Overview Section 
  • Monthly Dated Calendars Jan - Dec. 2017 with mini 2018 monthly planning section for looking ahead 
  • Commit30 30-day Challenge Tracking Section Each Month 
  • Weekly Calendar Layout - 7 days a week - MONDAY - SUNDAY WEEKLY LAYOUT plus “Life & Work to do list" sections. Weekly layout has space for meetings, tasks, meal planning, errands, calls to make, exercise tracking & more - totally customizable based upon users needs. See images below for examples of weekly layout. 
  • Highlighted monthly corners for quickly flipping thru to find the month you need 
  • Motivational quotes each month 
  • Project Planning, Notes & Sketching Section at bottom of each weekly layout & in each month section. 
  • Blank Notes section each month and at the end of planner - take notes in meetings; jot ideas (40 blank pages) 
  • Made with a PU faux leather durable cover (no animals were harmed in the making of this planner) with environmentally friendly materials (FSC certified paper stock) 
  • Included Accessories - Page marking ribbon, elastic enclosure band (also doubles as a pen holder) & back pocket!
  • Printed on super smooth high quality, ink proof paper (100gsm) thick paper - about twice as thick as a standard sheet of printer paper to limit ink bleeding from fountain pens & permanent markers. 

Flip through all 240 pages. Preview the entire Commit30 Planner. Click Here.

 

There are 12 Commit30 Challenge tracking pages in the planner (one for each month). This is the area to track & check-off the days you worked towards your goal or healthy habits. The key is to have as many checked circles each month as you can – try not to break the chain. If you miss a day or a few days in a row don’t worry – just look at each new day as a chance to start fresh. Aim to spend at least 30 minutes a day working towards a goal or healthy habit. 30 minutes a day x 30 days a month = 15 HOURS of time spent on your goals!

12 motivational quotes throughout the book to help keep you motivated & committed to your goals. 

  

Join the thousands of other Commit30 users to reach your goals & dreams and make time for what matters most! 

“Immediately after getting started with the Commit30 planner I felt a renewed sense of purpose; motivation & confidence in the direction of my life.” – Liz N.

"This is the tool I was looking for (I wish I had this thing during law school)! Thanks again for taking the risk and making this product." – Maha I. 

"This is exactly the tool I’ve been looking for to help me make the most of my days and go after my big goals.” – Jana W.

"I wanted let you know how much I’m enjoying my Commit30. For the month of January, I committed to eating at home for every meal with my family." – Emily L.

“Six days into my first #whole30 program and it’s worth all the effort if you ask me. The Commit30 Challenge checklist is helping me stay committed." - Carrie S.

  

  • September - October – Crowdfunding Campaign 
  • September - October – Printing & Production 
  • October - November - Fulfillment (Packaging & Shipping to our backers!)

We are launching the campaign early to ensure you all have your planners in hand in plenty of time to start planning your best year ever! Our initial production run of planners will begin before the campaign ends, ensuring an early shipping date! You can get all of your holiday shopping done as Commit30 planners make perfect gifts for family, friends & co-workers. 

Thank you to all of the people who have helped bring this product to life. And thanks for your support!  Share your progress #commit30

Graphic Design: Gaia Creative 

Video production: Exposure Productions

Photography: Red Scarf Shots

story:
About US 

Umee Media LLC is a preincubator secure cloud based app creation and management platform for young developers, entrepreneurs, & other users in college. Plans to provide college developers, entrepreneurs, and other users the tools they need to become successful, and a platform to grow their idea at low cost.

Build a team of novel young go-getters using our social forum to create and develop the newest and best applications at a very low and affordable price. The goal of the platform is to create: 1) A very secure network, 2) An app management and creation software for students, and 3) A cloud based system; all at a low affordable cost for students.

Learn the 'Ins' and 'Out's' of software application development.


Want To Learn More?

  1. You can learn more about the Umee Media LLC platform at www.facebook.com/UmeeUs
  2. If you would like to learn more about myself please view find me on

           https://www.facebook.com/umaar.eisaan (Facebook)
           http://www.linkedin.com/pub/umaar-ehsan/41/8a/6b8 (LinkedIn)

      4.  Shortly, Umee Media will be open to a larger group of users. If you would like to register, please visit www.Umee.Us.

 

                                 THANK YOU FOR HELPING & BEING HERE :)!

story:
Introduction

    My name is Rob Hollis, founder of CEDC the Colorado Environmental Design Company. I like to spend time outdoors riding my bikes and boards, my connection with nature led me to studies in Biology where I realized that there was a large issue with the degradation of natural environments and ecosystems. Through the wormhole (and some travel), I came across the field of Environmental Design, where creatives can explore the relationship humans have with space and furthermore the relationship with the materials and processes used to create it. From a bathroom environment to a tundra environment, Environmental Design seeks to improve the connection and experience that people have with their surroundings.


Credentials

    Rob Hollis is an active member of the campus community at the University of Colorado at Boulder. A senior in the program in Environmental Design (ENVD), Rob represents the student body as a current voting member and promotions coordinator of the CU Student Government Environmental Center Student Board, the current Boulder Campus Planning Commission Environmental Center student representative, the current CU Campus Ethics Committee Environmental Design student representative and formerly, Rob was an ENVD Peer Mentor and a CU GOLD Executive Board member and Community Services Coordinator. Rob is currently working as the Sustainability Coordinator on a ground-breaking project with the CU Athletics Nutrition Department which will be coming online this Spring 2015 to stimulate the fresh food program for the student athletes.


The Campaign

    As a response to the growing demand for sustainability in architecture and the increased need to manage resources, the CEDC would like to fund a sustainability consultation for an architectural commission; a 900 square foot timber-frame barn and utility structure. The consultation firm will focus on the extensive reduction of the overall impact of the design and construction process.

  The step towards sustainability in architecture is to the likeness of the modern food movement, where the entire paradigm is changing from large high-volume centralized food operations to localized farm to table and community supported agriculture programs. The concept is clear; we want to be connected. Connected with our resources, connected with our communities.

The Numbers on Green Building

40% of global waste is produced by the construction industry with buildings representing 72% of U.S. energy consumption.

An average U.S. home can produce up to 7 tons of waste during the construction process.

Green-certified homes are valued at 8-10% more, produce lower energy bills by up to 50% and experience greater lifespans.

The Funding

    The sustainability consultation will  be performed by GreenSpot Denver (http://yourgreenspot.com/) to achieve both an Energy Star and LEED certified rating. Energy Star requires that the building complies with a higher energy code obtained through the building envelope, HVAC, air quality and water management. LEED nails down every available sustainability feature and considers metrics such as material transport distance, resource processing and material manufacturing. The drawings were submitted to GreenSpot this Fall and the project has been quoted at $5000* with a comment describing that the bill often comes in less. One of the “perks” for this project is especially exciting, four contributions of $1000 or more will receive furniture built from material actually recycled from the building site! This custom piece will be built by the architect and defines the term “Environmental Design.”

*note: If the project exceeds its initial funding requirement of $5000 by $1000, we will also strive for The Living Building Challenge! Exceed by $2000 and we will develop a complete project graphics kit describing all the innovative features of the project!
  


The Impact

     There are three major components driving the green building industry; unprecedented Washington initiatives, increased residential demand and dramatic improvements in sustainable materials. In the last decade, students across the nation have been advocating for LEED rated buildings on their campuses as well as heightened recycling and sustainability outreach programs. Nations such as Taiwan have been environmentally pressured to rethink their life support systems and have created museums and cultural centers entirely out of plastic bottles! We have an opportunity in the U.S. to continue to lead and explore the possibilities and advantages of green-building, it is up to us to move forward in a culturally responsible and creatively independent way.


Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cannot contribute today, I encourage you to explore the world of environmental design, sustainable construction and green-building!

  Also, feel free to use the IndieGoGo tools to share with family and friends across the world!

Thank You,
Rob Hollis

p.s. Drawings of the barn to be built are in the "Gallery" section (the tab is at the top of the page). The "Gallery" also includes two video links, one explains Energy Star certifications while the other explains LEED certifications.
story_txt:
Introduction    My name is Rob Hollis, founder of CEDC the Colorado Environmental Design Company. I like to spend time outdoors riding my bikes and boards, my connection with nature led me to studies in Biology where I realized that there was a large issue with the degradation of natural environments and ecosystems. Through the wormhole (and some travel), I came across the field of Environmental Design, where creatives can explore the relationship humans have with space and furthermore the relationship with the materials and processes used to create it. From a bathroom environment to a tundra environment, Environmental Design seeks to improve the connection and experience that people have with their surroundings.Credentials    Rob Hollis is an active member of the campus community at the University of Colorado at Boulder. A senior in the program in Environmental Design (ENVD), Rob represents the student body as a current voting member and promotions coordinator of the CU Student Government Environmental Center Student Board, the current Boulder Campus Planning Commission Environmental Center student representative, the current CU Campus Ethics Committee Environmental Design student representative and formerly, Rob was an ENVD Peer Mentor and a CU GOLD Executive Board member and Community Services Coordinator. Rob is currently working as the Sustainability Coordinator on a ground-breaking project with the CU Athletics Nutrition Department which will be coming online this Spring 2015 to stimulate the fresh food program for the student athletes. The Campaign     As a response to the growing demand for sustainability in architecture and the increased need to manage resources, the CEDC would like to fund a sustainability consultation for an architectural commission; a 900 square foot timber-frame barn and utility structure. The consultation firm will focus on the extensive reduction of the overall impact of the design and construction process.  The step towards sustainability in architecture is to the likeness of the modern food movement, where the entire paradigm is changing from large high-volume centralized food operations to localized farm to table and community supported agriculture programs. The concept is clear; we want to be connected. Connected with our resources, connected with our communities.The Numbers on Green Building40% of global waste is produced by the construction industry with buildings representing 72% of U.S. energy consumption. An average U.S. home can produce up to 7 tons of waste during the construction process. Green-certified homes are valued at 8-10% more, produce lower energy bills by up to 50% and experience greater lifespans. The Funding    The sustainability consultation will  be performed by GreenSpot Denver (http://yourgreenspot.com/) to achieve both an Energy Star and LEED certified rating. Energy Star requires that the building complies with a higher energy code obtained through the building envelope, HVAC, air quality and water management. LEED nails down every available sustainability feature and considers metrics such as material transport distance, resource processing and material manufacturing. The drawings were submitted to GreenSpot this Fall and the project has been quoted at $5000* with a comment describing that the bill often comes in less. One of the “perks” for this project is especially exciting, four 
contributions of $1000 or more will receive furniture built from material
 actually recycled from the building site! This custom piece will be 
built by the architect and defines the term “Environmental Design.”*note: If the project exceeds its initial funding requirement of $5000 by $1000, we will also strive for The Living Building Challenge! Exceed by $2000 and we will develop a complete project graphics kit describing all the innovative features of the project!   The Impact     There are three major components driving the green building industry; unprecedented Washington initiatives, increased residential demand and dramatic improvements in sustainable materials. In the last decade, students across the nation have been advocating for LEED rated buildings on their campuses as well as heightened recycling and sustainability outreach programs. Nations such as Taiwan have been environmentally pressured to rethink their life support systems and have created museums and cultural centers entirely out of plastic bottles! We have an opportunity in the U.S. to continue to lead and explore the possibilities and advantages of green-building, it is up to us to move forward in a culturally responsible and creatively independent way. Other Ways You Can Help     If you cannot contribute today, I encourage you to explore the world of environmental design, sustainable construction and green-building!  Also, feel free to use the IndieGoGo tools to share with family and friends across the world!Thank You,Rob Hollisp.s. Drawings of the barn to be built are in the "Gallery" section (the tab is at the top of the page). The "Gallery" also includes two video links, one explains Energy Star certifications while the other explains LEED certifications.

story:
THE SHORT AND SWEET

CampuZoic is the only mobile app company geared at revolutionizing the college experience. It digitally transforms the urban landscape of colleges, via smart phone technology. We have already built a working prototype for Cal Poly Pomona which has been a huge success and we would like to bring it to at least 100 more college campuses over the next year. This is directly where your backing will come into play. Your backing will be used toward expanding our database of college information, marketing at each college we support, and any further development that is required to fix bugs and improve the app.

WHO WE ARE

The name CampuZoic is a word mash of “campus” and the suffix “zoic,” referring to life or existence, so quite literally, CampuZoic means “Campus Life.” CampuZoic’s founding partners, Shawn Irvin and Adeline Ramirez have been working together in Southern California on mobile applications for iPhone and Android platforms since early 2009. Shawn Irvin is a recent Computer Information Systems graduate of Cal Poly Pomona while Adeline Ramirez is an entrepreneur with 2 degrees in philosophy and political science. During their partnership, Shawn thought it would be helpful to create an app for his college. This is where the desire began to bring this sort of mobile technology to college campuses across the nation.

WHERE WE’RE AT

We currently have a working prototype of CampuZoic for the campus of California State Polytechnic University, Pomona with an average user base of 2,000 users. Features include: News, Directory, Maps, Food, Web Links, and Cleeks (Clubs & Greeks).


Here are some reviews from students using our app:

Shaboudra - ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

“I am a new student and this made getting oriented to the campus a breeze. I felt plugged into everything the college has to offer. I’m even showing Seniors how to access things. I highly recommend this app!”

Reeds826 - ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

“It is so easy and user friendly! I highly recommend it. It will truly revolutionize your college experience ;)”

SAL_OM_E - ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

“This app is so helpful… I love being able to see what is open when I am hungry after 5 or lookup dept. telephone numbers ;)”

Our app is currently compatible with iPhones & iPod Touches running iOS 4.0 and higher and Android devices running 2.3 and higher. It maintains a 4 1/2 star rating on the iTunes App Store and a 4 star rating on Google Play.

You can download our iOS and Android working prototypes by clicking the two links below. If you like what you see, don’t hesitate to give us a 5 star rating!

 

WHERE WE WANT TO GO

In the short term, we’d like to support at least 100 schools over the next year. Plus, we have tons of ideas for more features no other college supported campus app can provide. In the long run, we’d like to be the main provider of college campus apps in the US. When students first start school in the Fall of each year, we want CampuZoic to be the first thing they think of to get acclimated to their campus.

FAQ

  • What exactly is the Indiegogo money going towards? We are planning to use the money generated from Indiegogo to gather information for more schools, market our app at those schools, and make sure that our app is as bug proof as possible and provides a rich and inviting experience to our users.
  • Don’t colleges already have their own mobile apps? They are few and far between, plus they don’t foster creativity or innovation because they are created by under funded and under staffed Universities and Colleges, which means loads of red tape. There are also certain features that college supported apps will never be able to provide due to legal or other reasons.
  • Not every college student owns a smart phone. Yes, but among smart phone users, college students are the fastest growing segment.
  • I can’t donate, how else can I help? No problem! Helping us spread the word is a wonderful contribution. Please forward the link to this Indiegogo campaign to everyone you know!
  • How long does it take to gather information for a school? On average, it takes about 6 hours to gather all of the information on a school and input it into our database.
  • What kind of schools can I pick if I back the project with the $125 or $250? At this time, we require that you only pick schools that are in the United States. We also recommend that the school have a good sized campus in order to accommodate the features that our app provides.

story:
GeminiPad is Worlds' 1st Foldable Dual Wireless Charger to fast charge all your Qi-embedded devices. The foldable hinge design makes GeminiPad Ultra Portable in your pocket, and wireless charges all your devices anytime and anywhere. 

Why GeminiPad?

Now, most people own multiple electronic devices, like iPhone, Apple Watch, and AirPods. All of these devices use a lot of different cables and multiple USB pots chargers, which are extremely inconvenient. GeminiPad is a revolutionary product that fixes all of these problems! Geminipad allows you to truly embrace the convenience of wireless charging. 

 

GeminiPad in the News

GeminiPad vs. Others

With flexible hinge design, GeminiPad can be flat, fold up, and stand. It is perfect for you to FaceTime or watch a video when the phone is charging. 

GeminiPad has dual fast wireless charging pads and can charge phones with 10W power. GeminiPad supports the latest Qi wireless charging version, including 7.5W high speed wireless charging for the iPhones as well as 10W high speed wireless charging for the Android devices. The conversion efficiency of GeminiPad has been increased to 80%, which is faster than most wireless chargers whose conversion rate is only up to 60%. GeminiPad can fast charge two phones simultaneously and save your half time comparing with single charger.

 

GeminiPad is foldable designed with durable hinge structure and ultra portable in your pocket. You can take it anywhere and charge all your devices anywhere. Gemini is a minimalistic modern wireless charger with two pads connect by a hinge. To ensure Gemini can charge two devices and the same time and to have the best charging pad design on the market, we use the round shape and keep it a palm-size pad. It also built heat dissipation vent on the bottom side of the pad to take the aesthetics and functionality both into consideration.

InvisibleTech was founded in California by HKUST graduated PH. D in 2016. The mission of us is to make intelligent technology invisible. InvisibleTech is formed by a team of dynamic, energetic and creative designers who are longing to create thoughtful, affordable and high-quality products, and bring it into daily life. We love crowdfunding our new projects because we can communicate with people and get feedback immediately from backers.

InvisibleTech successfully finished its 1st Kickstarter campaign named ROBOQI in 2018. We sent all the rewards to the backers as we promised and got excellent feedback from backers all over the world.

With our professional experience and great service, we make sure to bring GeminiPad to the world. And now, we need your help to make this ultra travel charger visible to your life. Support GeminiPad today, and have great travel experience anywhere. Thanks.

For any questions please contact this email: hi@invzible.com

For more news, updates and more please follow us on:

 

The product in the video is only a prototype for testing and filming. We keep close contact with our manufacturers because we want to be prepared for any possible production obstacle. We have completed all testing and development. Our selected producers are ready to collaborate with us under our conditions and schedule. Your donations will cover the product expenses, packaging, assembly and shipping. We are committed to delivering the product on time with the highest quality. We are taking into account all challenges and risks in terms of developing, quality control and production. Time is always the most challenging part when trying to bring a product to life as there are so many procedures. However, with this being our Second Crowdfunding campaign, we can confidently say that we can handle all the procedures.  We have completed all testing and development. Our selected producers are ready to collaborate with us under our conditions and schedule. Your donations will cover the product expenses, packaging, assembly and shipping. We believe that our experienced team can well mitigate all potential risks in this journey. If there’s any obstacle, we will definitely keep you in the loop. With your supports, we can bring GeminiPad worldwide.

story:
9 LIVES FOR YOUR WRIST.

What if the millions of keystrokes, mouse-clicks, and gestures could be easier and more natural? Multiplied over the course of a career, the negative impact of repetitive motion and strain would be reduced, adding "9 lives" to your wrist!

MAGNETIC LEVITATION.

Wristocat uses magnetic levitation to neutralize repetitive strain and minimize resistance, all while boosting your performance. 

With your hand floating on a friction-free magnetic field, every click, keystroke, and gesture is fully supported and virtually effortless. 

Whether you click a mouse, tap a keyboard, gesture on a touchpad, or spend time gaming, Wristocat is your “Hands Best Friend.” 

THE PURR-FECT LANDING.

Wristocat's interchangeable supports ensure the perfect landing.  Fine tune your Wristocat's personality with color and support add-ons for style, therapy, variety, and performance.

And since every wristocat add on is designed to attach magnetically, interchange is a literal "snap."  Simply lift off, replace, and keep going. 

INTERCHANGEABLE SUPPORTS.

The standard Wristocat support is designed to cradle the palm, keep your wrists aligned, and relieve pressure from the carpal tunnel area. It is constructed out of super-soft "memory foam" so your hand will PURRRRR!

The "Thermal Disc" adds therapeutic warmth and cooling. Inside the disc is a thermal layer with a special shape to maximize comfort and minimize pressure. The disc is constructed out of soft, food grade silicone to make it safe, comfortable, and easy to clean.

The Ultra Low Disc, also constructed from food grade silicon, is a favorite for those who appreciate minimalistic design and crave a lower profile. Prowling just millimeters above the surface, you may forget that it's even there!

#16 on cosmopolitan.com "35 Amazing Gifts That Anyone In Your Life Would Want" 

“Wristocat is Definitely Sexy." I like the sleekness of the product - it reminds me of an Apple Product” --Donna Michele Baxter, CEO / founder of Soul Pitt Media **

DISCLAIMER:

*Wristocat is not a medical device and we make no medical claims of any kind.  Do not use Wristocat in place of medical treatment.  If you suffer from a medical condition, or experience any pain, discontinue use and consult your doctor. 

WARNING - Wristocat uses powerful magnets that can cause physical harm.  Do not attempt to disassemble or repair.  The metal connecting plates inside the silicone supports can be sharp and should only be handled with caution.  Wristocat is designed for use near personal computers and equipment such as mouse and keyboard only.  Keep wristocat away from any medical device.Use at your own risk.

**We reserve the right to alter the product appearance.  Final manufactured product may differ from the prototypes and renderings shown to facilitate mass production, incorporate stretch goals, and/or improve product performance.  Actual photos of the physical product will be posted to the media section as the campaign progresses.

REFUNDS: Indiegogo will issue a full refund within 10 days of your contribution, before any fees are deducted.  You can initiate a refund directly from your confirmation email or Indiegogo account during the ten day period. To request a refund, please follow these steps. Refunds will be issued based on the payment method used to make the contribution, and may take up to 5 business days to appear on your statement. As campaign funds are being used to design, develop, manufacture, produce, and ship the product, we cannot issue refunds after funds have been transferred.

RETURNS: We will replace any manufacturer defective items returned to us within 15 days of delivery.  Requests posted to the message section cannot be processed and will be deleted.  Shipping costs are non refundable. 
 
IMPORT FEES, DUTIES, AND TAXES: The buyer is responsible for all import fees, customs duties, taxes,  and charges related to the import of the item.  By making a pledge, the backer agrees to pay all charges related to the import of the item.
 
LOST OR MISSING SHIPMENTS:  Shipping insurance is provided for international shipments.  If your parcel does not arrive within 45 days after shipment, notify us immediately so that we can help you file a claim.  All claims are subject to investigation. During the claims process, you will be required to submit a recipient statement/affidavit.  Without the recipient affidavit, the claim cannot be considered. A shipping insurance claim must be filed within 60 days for it to be valid. Any notification of a lost or missing shipment filed after 60 days of shipment will not qualify for insurance and Is subject to additional fees and shipping charges for another parcel to be sent.  
 

All contents © Wrivo, LLC. "Wristocat®" and "Hand's Best Friend®" are Registered Trademarks.  US and International Patents Issued. US and International Patents Pending.

THANK YOU FOR BACKING WRISTOCAT!
